data.event: In 1833, Oxford was officially incorporated as a borough.
Its first burgess (now called the mayor) was Thomas Alexander, who operated a general store thought to be the oldest building in Oxford.
Reverend John Miller Dickey and his wife Sarah Emlen Cresson founded Ashmun Institute in 1854, and which later became Lincoln University.
The railroad reached Oxford in 1860 and later connected to Philadelphia and Baltimore.

event.title: this time, including the Oxford Hotel (1858

data.event: The business district on Third Street was entirely re-built at this time, including the Oxford Hotel (1858) and Oxford Hall (1862).
